publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: At Sr Ar. Acheson's house in the North of Ireland.
Dermot and Shelagh.
A Nymph and Swain, Shelagh & Dermot hight,
Who wont to weed the Court of ·The Seat of Sr A. Acheson's family in Scotland. Gosford Knight,
While each wth stubbed knife remov'd the roots
That rais'd between the Stones their daily shoots,
As at their work they sat in counterview
With mutual beauty smit, their passion grew.
Sing, Heav'nly Muse, in sweetly flowing strain,
The soft endearments of the Nymph & Swain.

Dermot.
My love to Shelagh is more firmly fix't
Than strongest weeds that grow these stones betwixt,
My Spud these nettles from the stones can part,
No spud so keen to weed thee from my heart.

Shelagh.
My love for Gentle Dermot faster grows
Than yon tall dock that rises to thy nose:
Cut down the dock, 't·will sprout again, but Oh!
Love once cut off, again will never grow.

Dermot.
No more that bry'r thy tender leg shall rake,
I spare the ·Sr A. A. piques himself much upon his being a Scotchman. thistle for Sr Arthur's sake.
Sharp are the stones, take thou this rushy mat,
The hardest bum will bruise wth sitting squat.

Shelagh.
Thy breeches torn behind stand gaping wide
This petticoat shall save thy dear backside.
Nor need I blush althô you feel it wet,
Dermot, I vow 'tis nothing else but sweat.

Dermot.
At an old stubborn root I chanc'd to tug,
When the Dean threw me this Tobacco plug,
A longe half p.·worth never did I see,
This, Dearest Shelagh, thou shalt share wth me.

Shelagh.
In at the Pantry door this morn I slipt,
And from the shelf a charming crust I whipt.
·Sr Arthur's Butler. Dennis was out, and I got hither safe
And Thou, My Dear, shalt have the bigger half.

Dermot.
When you saw Tady at long bullets play,
You sat and lous'd him all a Summer's day.
How could you, Shelagh, listen to his tales?
Or crack such lice as his betwixt yr nayls.

Shelagh.
When you wth Oonoh stood behind a ditch
I peep'd, and saw you kiss the dirty bitch.
Dermot, how cd you touch those nasty Sluts?
I almost wish this spud was in your guts.

Dermot.
If Oonah once I kissd, forbear to chide,
Her Aunt's my Gossip by my Father's side,
But if I ever touch her lips again,
May I be doom'd for life to weed in rain.

Shelagh.
Dermot, I swear thô Tady's locks cd hold
Ten thousand lice, and ev'ry louse was gold,
Him on my lap you never more shd see,
Or may I lose my weeding knife──── and Thee.

Dermot.
O could I earn for Thee, my Dearest Lass,
A pair of brogues to bear Thee dry to Masse:
But see where Norah wth the ·Flummery. Sowings comes.
Then let us rise and rest our weary bums.
